title: birth punk scene uk photos
story: Original punk rock began as an artistic movement and an expression of counter-cultural angst, laying the foundations for the mainstream artists we know today.Photographer Derek Ridgers stumbled across the birth of punk by sheer accident in the late 70s, capturing on celluloid the essence of the most exciting cultural phenomenon in UK history.His snapshot of London’s youth culture and punk’s underground scene has been compiled in a new book, ‘Punk London 1977’, which documents the first wave of an incredible new era of music and fashion.The history of the genre remains largely unwritten, with years of verbal stories hoping to fill the gaps and decode what it means to be a ‘punk’.While the style was born in the US, music historians have often claimed that punk rock came to fruition in Britain in the late 70s.It was a time when increasing numbers of Britain’s disillusioned white teenagers began looking for an escape from the boredom and constraints of society, with unemployment, racial tensions and social upheaval providing fuel for their fires.Punk remained an underground scene until 1976, when two bands - The Ramones and The Sex Pistols – took the world by storm.The term punk rock was first used by certain American rock critics in the early 1970s to describe 1960s garage bands and subsequent acts then perceived as stylistic inheritors.The genre was a relatively well-established movement by the mid 1970s, and was inspired by the music of  the Velvet Underground, Iggy Pop and early David Bowie.Punk rockers were forced to make their own clothes as they werent available in shops yetAs 1977 approached, punk rock became a highly controversial cultural phenomenon in the United Kingdom.From it spawned a punk subculture expressing youthful rebellion characterised by distinctive styles of clothing and adornment  - ranging from deliberately offensive T-shirts, leather jackets, studded or spiked bands and jewellery, as well as bondage gear.The late 70s was also an era of anti-authoritarian ideologies that have since been associated with punk rock.

title: burn wood they said itll be green they said how the eco freaks got us all wheezing
story: Pollution in our cities is worse than it’s been for many years. The way things are going you could give your kids 20 Rothmans a day and they wouldn’t be much worse off than they already are.And the reason for this is a genuine scandal. A real eye-opener. It shows what happens when people in authority take notice of the people who know absolutely nothing. The Green lobby. The eco-freaks. The obsessive loons. The climate change fanatics.If you’re middle class, you’ve probably got one. They’ve become incredibly popular in the last decade.Trouble is they spew out enormous amounts of something called PM2.5 particles. That’s soot to you and me.They’re the major cause of soot in our cities and the main reason everyone you know is gasping for breath.We’re about to be sued by the European Union because pollution from these stoves is way above acceptable limits.But why do we have them?Because at the behest of the green movement, the government encouraged us all to have them. Burning wood is much better, they said, than gas or coal or oil. Renewable! Doesn’t churn out as much CO2!No, it just churns out lethal amounts of soot. Billions of pounds were spent by our government on a scheme to convert us to renewable heating systems.The brainchild of the disgraced Lib Dem halfwit Chris Huhne. Millions more was spent converting one of our biggest power stations to woodchip. The wood is shipped over 3,500 miles from the US (there’s eco-friendly for you). And it’s all made everything a lot, lot, worse as a consequence.Then there are diesel cars. You may have one. The government is getting tough on those, too.It’s now been discovered that they are much more polluting than petrol cars. It’s another major cause of pollution in our towns and cities.So why do we have them? Because the idiotic Greens told us to. Back in 2001 the Labour government offered tax breaks on diesel cars. Everyone rushed to buy one.A member of that Labour government has now ’fessed up and said it was the wrong decision, no question.But they wanted their Green credentials.And just look what trouble it has caused — 37,800 more deaths every year in this country simply as a consequence of those wood burning stoves. It is close to unbelievable.I wonder what the Greens will come up with next as an idea to save the planet.Maybe we should burn magpies, or sour cream and chive Pringles, or our own trousers.The truth is they haven’t got the remotest idea. They urge these measures upon us without the slightest notion of what might happen as a consequence.And the problem is that important people take them seriously. Governments, for example.And we end up paying through the nose for their idiocies — and then, a little later, gasping for breath.The wood burning stove business should convince all members of Parliament. Never listen to a green.No matter how nice he or she might seem. Just ignore them. They’re bad for your health.WHAT a shame – Roman Abramovich can’t get back into the country because we haven’t cleared his visa. So he’s sitting on his yacht somewhere, getting snippy. I’m not sure why we let Roman in in the first place.You don’t get his kind of money by being lovely to everybody, do you?First we helped wreck the Russian economy in the early 1990s by plundering its state run industries. Then we opened the doors to a whole bunch of Russkie gangsters – sorry, oligarchs – with boats the size of Poland. Anyway, I’ll probably end up glowing like a Belisha beacon just for writing this.BROADCASTER Dan Snow has admitted he lies to his daughters.He’s told them that during the war there were loads of female Spitfire pilots. Zooming around, shooting down krauts. He says he doesn’t want them to feel limited by their gender. He should have gone further. Told them that back then Britain was led by a nice lady called Winnie.And that the first person up Everest was a little girl called Hillary. And as for that Ada Hitler . . .THE Iraqis are executing the IS jihadi brides. Loads of them.Some of them are whining that they had no idea their husbands were evil Islamists. One of them said she thought she was marrying a rapper.Yeah, right love. We’ve got a few here, mind.Women who went out to join IS and then thought better of it. They’re lucky we won’t extradite them to Iraq.HEY – got your Royal Wedding gift bag yet? Guests to the wedding are flogging them on eBay for as little as £20,000. Hell of a bargain. I’ve got a bid in on one right now. It says it contains:I’VE got a bit of a soft spot for Victoria Beckham. She’s been criticised for not smiling at the wedding of Harry and Meghan.Some people have suggested Posh Spice was looking a bit grim because David had been out on the pull again. Nah. She wasn’t smiling because, basically, she’s a miserable cow.And I like that. Why should she have to wander around grinning like a village idiot?Keep the sulk and the pout, Vikki, love. Plus I liked what she was wearing at the bash. She was dressed as if for the funeral of someone she didn’t know very well. She looked great.SO, all four of the great American authors are dead. Both Tom Wolfe and Philip Roth died this week.Saul Bellow and the finest of them all, John Updike are already dead.These gentlemen were my heroes when I was growing up. But how long will they be remembered?Updike is already unfashionable on account of his alleged sexism. Wolfe and Bellow were quite right-wing, so the literary critics will quickly consign their books to the “dead white male” rubbish bin of history. And as a consequence, we will have lost an awful lot.Keep their work alive, whatever the critics tell you. Read The Bonfire of the Vanities, or Couples, or The Dean’s December and marvel at the insight and the beauty of the prose . . .Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: woman battered unconscious in the street after she told man pestering her to leave her alone
story: Chelsie Teighler Davies, 24,  claims she was assaulted by a mystery girl while showing her friend the nightlife in her home town of Swansea.Chelsie then reveals she was approached by a man who had been coming on to her all evening just as she left Oxygen nightclub.While she waited for her own taxi, she says the man from inside the club kept asking her to go back to his place with him, and she again told him to leave her alone.The pair then exchanged insults while she waited for a taxi and he walked away.Miss Davies said then a girl waiting behind her, part of a group of friends, said Don’t speak to him that way or I will take your head off.She remembers the girl walking towards her and then being taken to hospital after police attended the scene at around 5.25am.The 24-year-old, from Birchgrove, told WalesOnline: Police told me when I came around they found me unconscious.In hospital they explained what happened and asked me if I knew what the girl looked like.I was trying my hardest, but I can’t remember. I have been left with concussion and a bit of memory loss.I have got cuts and bruises, severe concussion, a black eye, the right-hand side of my face is swollen and I’ve got swelling and lumps to the back of my head.Miss Davies said the shocking experience has left her embarrassed and afraid.She said: Because I suffer from depression anyway it’s made me feel worse. I feel embarrassed more than anything that it’s happened to me and I’ve cried and cried over it.It’s been so frightening. It would change my mind about going out again 100 per cent. When I think back about what happened it makes my stomach flip.A South Wales Police spokeswoman said enquiries are ongoing and anyone who witnessed the incident but has not yet given an account to officers, is asked to contact 101, quoting occurrence 1800179020.’Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: zombie activity alert florida
story: An alert was sent out on Sunday - just after the lights went out and Lake Worth descended into eerie blackness.The text warning read: Power outage and zombie alert for the residents of Lake Worth and Terminus. There are now far less than 7,380 customers involved due to extreme zombie activity.But the official message also referenced a Zombie alert for Lake Worth and Terminus, which also referenced the hit AMC TV show, The Walking Dead and spin-off programme Fear of the Walking Dead, reports the Miami Herald.And although some residents were left fearing a zombie apocalypse, many believe the stark messages were no more than a wind-up.Community Facebook page Lake Worth Live posted a message from the city, stating that the zombie message was unintended.Ben Kerr, the city’s public information officer, said in a post: “We are looking into reports that the system mentioned zombies.I want to reiterate that Lake Worth does not have any zombie activity currently and apologize for the system message.”Kerr did, however, confirm that 7,800 homes were left without power.On a group Google Plus page, one commentator wrote: Okay, the alert went out as a prank, s***t happens. But... why did the public information officer feel that an official denial was necessary.And, why did he say there was no zombie activity *currently*?...

title: bank holiday weather latest britain hotter than hawaii
story: Temperatures across the country are set to be twice the seasonal average as the UK enjoys its hottest day of the year so far.The country is set to bask in the hottest late May Bank Holiday in almost 70 years, as a Mediterranean plume carried hot air upwards from the continent.Temperatures in the South East are likely to reach 30C, while the rest of the country will see peaks of 27C.Most of the UK is set to remain warm and clear in the lead up to the weekend, however some parts of the UK will be hit by isolated thunderstorms.The hottest day of the year so far saw temperatures peak at 29.1C, on April 19.This year has already been a record breaker as the early Spring Bank Holiday was the hottest on record, with 28.7C recorded at RAF Northholt in west LondonThe sunny weather is set to shine across Britain for the rest of the month as high pressure from the continent is expected to bring with it a mini-heatwave.A Met Office spokesperson said: “The average temperature for this time of year is 15C (59F).Currently, temperatures are averaging 20C (68F) and are only going to get warmer this weekend.”However, the increasingly humid conditions will bring the risk of thundery showers over the coming days.Forecasters say showers will hit central and southern parts of UK on Thursday, with clearer skies across the north and east.Heavy rain showers will continue across most of the UK on Friday into Saturday morning but should clear as the Bank Holiday getaways begin.Brian Gaze, director and forecaster for the Weather Outlook, told The Sun Online: “Unusually the warm conditions look set to last through the Bank Holiday weekend and the mercury may rise further.“Temperatures of 27C (81F) are possible in the south as a plume of warm air is pulled up from southern Europe.“Despite the sizzling weather scattered thunderstorms in the south have the potential to put a dampener on some barbecues and near the East Coast an east or north-easterly breeze will keep it cooler and possibly cloudier.“The warmth should hang around until early June at least.”The maximum temperature ever recorded for a late May Bank Holiday was 32.8C (91F), on May 29, 1944 in Horsham, Sussex.Dr Claire Kennedy-Edwards, senior meteorologist for the Weather Company, told the Sun Online that this year had the potential of smashing that record.Families planning on a Bank Holiday getaway have been warned to expect traffic misery on the roads.Motorists have been warned to expect hours of delays as millions take to the roads over the weekend, with average journey times double the usual.Improvement work on the railways will also see commuters suffering with delays and cancellations.There are 400 sets of work taking place on railway lines, with no trains calling at Swindon station between Saturday and Monday, and buses will replace trains between Lancaster and Glasgow and Edinburgh.There are no trains between Romford and Upminster, or between Barking and Liverpool Street, pushing more traffic onto the motorways.

title: hawaiians watch lava eat their street in devastating slow motion
story: We pull in to Kaupili Street and an extraordinary scene.An active fissure is pushing a vast, bubbling lava field along the road, eating up trees and properties along the way.It gurgles and snakes forward, hissing and popping a slow motion, unstoppable destructive force. Incongruously, some residents have come to take selfies as the rainforest bursts into flames and the tarmac under our feet heats up.But for others this is an awful moment.Mum and daughter Lori and Alyssa Cruz comfort one another as the lava envelops a neatly painted postbox.They know if the lava keeps moving like this their home will be gone soon. Lori said: "I live right up here, and I have already evacuated everything."I just came down to say goodbye to my neighbourhood one last time."When you know everyone on this road, you're like a family, you know, it's devastating.Alyssa said: "I didn't know what to expect but I was hoping that my house wasn't going to get destroyed."I guess God had other plans."It is steam shooting up into the air from further back in the river of molten rock.The locals say it's time to move, worried it could be a new fissure opening up or the beginning of a series of explosions.From a slightly safer distance, we watch as it slows down, and people gather to wonder.Hawaii's Big Island is a spiritual place, and a surprising number of people directly affected by the eruptions have been resolutely philosophical about what is happening to them, often embracing the chance to commune with Pele, who they believe is the goddess of fire and volcanoes.Resident Howard Rosin said: "It is tragic and in another way it's really beautiful because it's absolute destruction and creation at the same time."It's primordial. Cosmic soup." Night falls and the sky glows orange above us.The wind shifts so we put gas masks on to protect against sulphur dioxide as we walk to a different vantage point.From the ridge we take in another extraordinary sight.Multiple fissures and merging lava fields stretch as far as we can see, the power of mount Kilauea on full display.

title: nerves as far right league party set for office in italy and what we can expect
story: A deal which outlines the prospective government's programme was presented to the president on Monday evening.It comes after weeks of tense negotiations in the eurozone's third largest economy.It has at its core billions of euros in tax cuts, increased welfare payments for the poor and the scrapping of unpopular pension reforms.Both parties also want to pursue an aggressive crackdown on immigration and favour a shift towards Russia on foreign policy, with the lifting of sanctions against Moscow.Members of Five Star and the League were consulted and approved the joint plan published last week.All that remains now is for Mr Conte to finalise the make-up of his government and for the official swearing in.While there will be relief that a government can finally be installed, there will be concern that Italy could now become a source of political, economic and financial risk for the European Union.Five Star was co-founded by comedian Bepper Grillo in 2009 under an anti-establishment banner to fight corruption and politics as we know it. It is led by 31-year-old Luigi Di Maio.They have called for the quick deportation of an estimated 500,000 immigrants from Italy and are demanding more help from Brussels in trying to deal with people entering the country - predominantly from north Africa.The pair have called the EU's rules on migration "unsustainable for Italy", demanding an overhaul of the so-called Dublin rules which oblige migrants to apply for permission to stay in the country where they first arrive.Then there is Russia.Mr Di Maio and Mr Salvini say the country should not be perceived as a threat "but as an economic and trade partner".

title: nfl bans players from kneeling during national anthem
story: His remarks prompted a wave of further protests across the 2017 NFL season, putting several conservative Trump-supporting team owners in an awkward position.NFL chiefs were reluctant to introduce a law ordering players to stand for the anthem, with Wednesday's deal intended to be a compromise.The change will remove existing regulations that require all footballers to be on the field for the anthem.NFL commissioner Roger Gooddell said in a statement: "This season, all league and team personnel shall stand and show respect for the flag and the anthem." He continued: "If anyone is on the field and is disrespectful to the anthem or the flag, there will be a fine from the league against the team."The team will have its own rules and make their own decisions."The union added: "The vote by NFL club CEOs today contradicts the statements made to our player leadership by commissioner Roger Goodell and the chairman of the NFL's management council, John Mara, about the principles, values and patriotism of our league."Our union will review the new 'policy' and challenge any aspect of it that is inconsistent with the collective bargaining agreement."Mr Kaepernick has been unable to secure a team in the NFL since he first knelt in protest at a pre-season season game on 26 August 2016.

title: pictured meghan and harry at first official royal outing
story: It is Harry and Meghan's first royal duty as husband and wife after they were married in a ceremony at St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle on Saturday.Harry began his speech at the palace by remembering those "affected by the tragic events at the Manchester Arena a year ago".The first anniversary of the deadly bombing was marked by a memorial service earlier on Tuesday at Manchester Cathedral.:: Why the new Duchess of Sussex cannot be Princess Meghan Harry also paid a moving tribute to his father for his charitable work over more than four decades. The prince said: "It is your selfless drive to affect change, whether that is to improve the lives of those who are on the wrong path, to save an important piece of our national heritage or to protect a particular species under threat, which William and I draw inspiration from every day."At one point, when a bee buzzed nearby, he fluffed his lines, prompting his bride and the Duchess of Cornwall to break into laughter. Meghan wore a dusky pink Flavia silk-crepe pencil dress from Goat, a make that the Duchess of Cambridge has been spotted wearing before.The dress by the British brand is officially priced at &#163590.:: 'Extraordinary moment': Stars' royal wedding snaps revealed Goat told Sky News that the outfit had been tailored to perfectly fit the duchess.The hat is understood to be a Philip Treacy dome hat made from sinamay that was custom made for Meghan.The price is described as being available on request.:: First official royal wedding photos Again, the make has been frequently warn by Meghan and Kate.The firm's website crashed shortly after the photos of the new duchess emerged.Harry was wearing traditional morning dress, with top hat and ecru waistcoat and mid blue tie.Guests at the garden party ranged from representatives from Age UK, the British Film Institute and the Gurkha Welfare Trust to the Parachute Regimental Association, the Royal Ballet and the Royal Canadian Dragoons - all with a close association with Charles.Harry ended his speech by saying to his father: "You have inspired William and I, and looking out here today, it is clear to see that we are not alone."Corporal Gregory Gilbert, from 2nd Battalion, Irish Regiment of Canada, which has Charles as its colonel-in-chief, said meeting Harry and Meghan was "wonderful" after he and his colleagues flew over for the party. The wife of another Canadian soldier, Janine Killen, also spoke to Meghan about Toronto where Meghan had filmed Suits.Ms Killen said: "I always thought the royals were from far, far away but they are very down to earth."They can meet anybody, anywhere and have the right words to say.":: What did Harry say to wedding dress designer Clare Waight Keller? It comes as Meghan's father Thomas Markle was spotted for the first time since missing his daughter's wedding to undergo heart surgery.The 73-year-old was pictured buying frapuccinos from a coffee shop in Rosarito, Mexico.In the images, he is carrying a plastic bag which appears to have the words "personal belongings" on the side and could be from a hospital.:: Meghan's nephew Tyler Dooley warned by police over nightclub knife Meghan's half-sister Samantha Grant, who now goes by the name of Samantha Markle, called on her sister to heal a rift in their family.Meghan's mother, Doria Ragland, was the only member of her family to attend her wedding to Prince Harry.Ms Markle's relationship with her duchess sister has been rocky, and she has written a book about their childhood, which she called The Diary of Princess Pushy's Sister.Mr Markle told his children to "shut up about everything" following the wedding, TMZ reported.

title: labour slammed theresa giving lgbt
story: NewsLabour has slammed Theresa May for giving LGBT people “empty PR” instead of action on discriminationIn an interview with Gay Times, published today, the Prime Minister announced the government will publish its LGBT Action Plan this summer&nbspShareByMikey SmithPolitical reporter00:01, 24 MAY 2018NewsLabour have accused the PM of dragging her heels over discrimination (Image: REX/Shutterstock)&nbspShareGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailLabour has slammed Theresa May for giving LGBT people “empty PR” instead of action on discrimination. In an interview with Gay Times, published today, the Prime Minister announced the government will publish its LGBT Action Plan this summer. But she failed to reveal any information about the plan, or any specific details of the survey that led to its formulation. She said: “Last summer I announced a survey of LGBT people in Britain.  The response was phenomenal with over 100,000 people replying, making it the largest survey of LGBT people anywhere in the world.  “One answer that stood out to me was how many LGBT people said they avoided being open about their sexual orientation or gender identity in public, or with their own family and friends. I want to help make us a country where no one feels the need to hide who they are or who they love. “We will publish the full results soon. And while these findings might not come as news to many in the community, they do allow government to focus on what more it needs to do to tackle discrimination in every walk of life. Whether that is at home, in the playground, in the workplace, or in public.” She added: “That is why we will also publish an LGBT Action Plan this summer.  It will set out concrete steps the Government will take to improve lives for LGBT people in this country and address some of the injustices the community has faced.” Labour’s Shadow Minister for Women and Equalities said the Prime Minister’s words did not go far enough.

title: theresa been accused creating generation
story: NewsTheresa May has been accused of creating a "generation of undocumented people" through her "hostile environment"SNP MP Ian Blackford said the Tories' immigration crackdown has "targeted those who legally live here"&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent21:00, 23 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheresa May has been accused of creating a generation of undocumented people through her hostile environment immigration policy. SNP leader in Westminster Ian Blackford said that the Windrush Scandal had revealed that the Tories' immigration crackdown has targeted those who legally live here. And he raised the plight of young people who have grown up in the UK and know of nothing else face losing their lawful settled status because they simply cannot afford the paperwork. Mr Blackford, who has been damning in his criticism of the Government's attitude to immigrants, raised the issue at Prime Minister's Questions. Speaking in the House of Commons he warned that they are struggling to find the money to secure their immigration status because Home Office fees have increased by 148% since 2014.  These children have the right to be here the UK is their home, he said. I am giving the Prime Minister the opportunity today: will she scrap these fees for young people, as she has done for the Windrush generation? The Prime Minister insisted that a minor who has indefinite leave to remain will have access to benefits and entitlements which put them on an equal footing to their British citizen peers, so a grant of British citizenship is not therefore required. But Mr Blackford insisted there were about up to 120,000 young people in the UK in this difficult position.  We are talking about young people who live here, who have to wait 10 years and pay up to &pound10,000 to achieve permanent right to remain. It is shocking.  The Government are guilty of creating a generation of undocumented citizens without the rights that many of us take for granted. Will the Prime Minister change her policies that target young people? The Prime Minister said she did not recognise the &pound10,000 figure he quoted. And she repeated the point that a minor who has indefinite leave to remain will have access to the benefits and entitlements that put them on an equal footing to their British citizen peers. A grant of British citizenship is not required in order for someone to access those rights and benefits.

title: theresa washed hands proposed sale
story: NewsTheresa May has washed her hands of the proposed sale of Wembley Stadium insisting it is a private matterShe was urged to speak out after American billionaire Shahid Khan tabled a multi-million pound bid for the national stadium&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter20:40, 23 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheresa May has washed her hands of the proposed sale of Wembley Stadium, insisting it was a private matter for owners to decide. She was urged to speak out after American billionaire Shahid Khan tabled a multi-million pound bid for the national stadium. Mr Khan owns the Jacksonville Jaguars NFL American football team, and wants to make Wembley their official home.  It would be the first NFL side to be based outside of the US in a deal reportedly worth &pound1bn. But speaking at Prime Minister’s Questions, Labour’s Justin Madders said: I'm sure the Prime Minister, like millions of other people, was glued to her TV set on Saturday watching an event of national importance. Sadly, there was not a fairytale ending, as Chelsea won the FA Cup.  But that could be the last FA Cup final played at Wembley before it is sold to an overseas owner. When Premier League clubs spend hundreds of millions of pounds every year on wages and transfers, does the Prime Minister agree with me that there is actually more than enough money in the game for there to be no need to sell off this iconic national asset? The Prime Minister said: Can I say to him, that is a decision for the owners of Wembley. It is a private matter, it is not a matter for the Government.  Labour deputy leader Tom Watson blasted May’s response. He said: “The sale of Wembley is not a 'private matter' as Theresa May has just said at PMQs. It's our national stadium and fans have to be heard. We are deeply sceptical of the proposal to sell Wembley.

title: elderly couple aged 79 81
story: NewsElderly couple, aged 79 and 81, find car FIVE days after forgetting where they parked itEmmanuel Elliott and Hilda Farmer parked their Ford Fiesta near Cheltenham General Hospital on Friday to attend an appointment&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByHeather McNeill23:27, 23 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn elderly couple who forgot where they parked their car have been reunited with the vehicle FIVE days later. Emmanuel Elliott, 81, and partner, Hilda Farmer, 79, had parked their Ford Fiesta somewhere near Cheltenham General Hospital in Gloucestershire on Friday afternoon for Emmanuel to attend an appointment. Hilda said she dropped her partner at the entrance and then found a parking spot within a mile and a half of the building, on a street she thought had nice houses on one side. When the couple returned from their appointment, however, their car was nowhere to be found.  Family and friends spent days trawling the nearby streets without success in an attempt to help the Gloucester couple find the vehicle - they even offered a reward on Tuesday of &pound100 to anyone who could locate it. The Fiesta was discovered a day later in the St George's Road car park about 900 metres from the hospital and had been ticketed three times by wardens. Hilda said she must have dreamt she parked it beside houses. She said her granddaughter played a major role in locating the car after launching a public appeal on social media for locals to keep an eye out for the silver Fiesta.  The post went viral and attracted the attention of local news outlets, with several people soon contacting media to say they had seen the car. The relieved couple's reunion with their vehicle was filmed by TV crews who had published stories in the days prior about the parking mystery.  Hilda told Gloucestershire Live : It feels crazy. Aren't we lucky to live in a country where an old aged pensioner's car gets national news coverage? Thank God we live in England.  My granddaughter has got hundreds of people on her Facebook. She put the appeal on there and someone has seen the car. We're really happy because it's the only car we have got. We had to go on our bikes yesterday. I prefer riding my bike to driving a car, but there are some things you can't do without a car. Emmanuel told the BBC it was marvellous to have found it. He said: It's been quite a five days. I hope I can remember how to drive.

title: feminist meghan markle going more
story: NewsopinionFeminist Meghan Markle is going to be more than just Prince Harry's arm candyThe Duchess of Sussex will be using her huge platform to support causes that help the advancement of women - and insiders say she has the blessing of the palace to do so&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByEva Simpson00:13, 23 MAY 2018NewsopinionMeghan is a breath of fresh air who will shake up the Royal Family (Image: Getty)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe confetti has been swept away, Serena Williams has stopped giving us updates on Instagram and the embarrassing Markle half-siblings have headed back to America, hopefully never to be heard from again. And now, for the Duchess of Sussex, the serious work begins.  She and Prince Harry were already back on royal duties yesterday at a Buckingham Palace garden party celebrating Prince Charles’ 70th birthday .  But she has made it clear that her role in “the Firm” will be to do more than wear stylish dresses or just be arm candy for her husband.  Shortly after the wedding, her official biography on the Buckingham Palace website was out and in it she boldly announced she is “proud to be a woman and a feminist”. It was a signal she will be using her huge platform to support causes that help the advancement of women. Insiders say she has the blessing of the palace to do so.  It didn’t take long for the haters to pile in at the mention of the word feminist and I must admit that I initially groaned at the thought.  Of course I believe in equality of men and women which, by definition, makes me a feminist. But I’ve always felt excluded from feminism and feminist debates because they’re always dominated by one voice – well-off middle-class women. Instead of being inclusive, it is exclusive and rarely addresses the views and needs of ethnic minority or working-class women. It seems those who benefit most are usually already well paid and well connected. I’ve been to networking events about gender equality in business or the media and I can usually count the number of non-white women on one hand. During panel discussions I never hear anyone talking about tackling the lack of social or racial diversity. Instead it’s a certain group of women fighting for women like themselves. Women of colour have fought against sexism and racism, but their voice is rarely heard. I believe Meghan can change that. Yes she’s well-off and privileged, but her background, and the fact she was raised by a black woman, gives her a different perspective.  As her bio says, she’s had a keen awareness of social issues from an early age, instilled by her wonderful mother Doria Ragland . “Those early experiences helped shape her lifelong commitment to causes such as social justice and women’s empowerment,” it says.

title: it felt amazing alton towers
story: News"It felt amazing": Alton Towers amputee Leah Washington runs for first time since Smiler rollercoaster crash three years agoLeah was just 17 years old when the rollercoaster crashed into a test car - crushing her leg amongst the twisted metal of the ride&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByAbigail O'Leary14:36, 23 MAY 2018Updated15:53, 23 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAlton Towers amputee Leah Washington has run for first time three years after the devastating Smiler rollercoaster crash. Leah was just 17 years old when the coaster crashed into a test car, crushing her leg amongst the twisted metal of the ride. Brave Leah was taken to hospital where doctors failed to save her injured leg. Now, three years on, Leah, from Barnsley in South Yorkshire, has shared footage of her running for the very first time. She shared a video of her smiling while running alongside her physio Carolyn - captioning the clip: 'This is my first time running since my accident. it felt amazing'. Leah was on a first date with her now long-term boyfriend Joe Pugh on the day of the crash.  Joe today congratulated Leah on the milestone moment, tweeting: YES GAL. Such a achievement.    Leah spoke earlier this year about the horrific accident and the moment doctors told her they had to remove her leg. Describing the ill-fated rollercoaster ride to Cosmopolitan, Leah said: I started yelling, no no no, and then...there was nothing. Only blackness, The next thing I remember was the screaming and the blood. There was so much of it. The metal of the safety bars had folded into our bodies. When she was finally freed Leah was taken to hospital, but doctors could not save her leg. The doctor came over in a white coat, she told Cosmo. He had kind, sad eyes and spoke to me slowly.  'I’m so sorry. I had to amputate your left leg. It was seriously injured. It was the only way I could save you.' The 24-year-old has started blog, Limbitless , and documented her journey from being afraid she might not be able to run, to ordering prosthetics blades and taking on a 10k race. “Everybody is unique and people should be proud of that. I would love to help other people and that is my aim really. It not only helps them but helps me too.” Last year Leah posted a series of stunning pictures from her summer holiday with Joe, showing her full prosthetic leg while wearing a bikini.

title: new mum overjoyed pass driving
story: NewsNew mum overjoyed to pass driving test - only to have licence taken off her the NEXT dayKelsie Murphy, 22, was gutted when the test centre rang her up on her birthday and told her she had been wrongly issued a 'pass'&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByEleanor SharplesSophie Evans12:52, 23 MAY 2018Updated18:12, 23 MAY 2018NewsKelsie Murphy, from Kent, thought she had passed her driving test with just six minors (Image: Triangle News)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA new mum was overjoyed to 'pass' her driving test - only to have her licence revoked a day later because she'd actually failed. Kelsie Murphy was celebrating her birthday when the test centre contacted her and told her there had been an admin error. The 22-year-old says her examiner had gone through the test paper with her after she took the exam in Herne Bay, Kent, last month. She says he showed her she had received only six minors and told her: You’ve got yourself an early birthday present- you’ve passed! Kelsie was so delighted she was almost in tears - but her happiness turned to confusion when the test centre got in touch the next day.  She says she was told to return her pass certificate, with a major error having been recorded during her driving test on April 11. It remains unclear how she ended up being given an initial 'pass' result - but the centre has said there was an administrative error. It is thought she is the first person in Britain to have had their licence revoked before even receiving it. Kelsie said: “I have no idea where the major mark came from. As far as I knew, everything had gone smoothly. I feel like the unluckiest person ever because they told me it hasn’t happened to anyone but me.”  The mum-of-two had thought she had passed with half a dozen minors after taking the test at Herne Bay driving test centre. Drivers must have fewer than 15 minor faults and no major errors to pass and be issued with their interim driving licence. Kelsie claimed: “My examiner said ‘congratulations you’ve got yourself an early birthday present- you’ve passed!’ “I was so happy, nearly crying, but holding myself back because I didn’t want to embarrass myself. “I’ve been through a lot in my life and I was over the moon that things were finally going well for me.  “My driving instructor came running over to me because she could see the smile on my face. “The examiner went through the paper with us, showing me that I only had six minors.” Kelsie, from Broadstairs, Kent, was ecstatic to have 'passed' the test after previously failing on her first attempt. She returned home to celebrate with her family and friends, where she was greeted with congratulatory balloons, banners and cards. Her mum had helped her to buy a car, and she sent her papers off to the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency to get her driving licence. But a day later, while celebrating her birthday, she received a call from the test centre asking her to return the pass certificate to them.  Shockingly, she says they then told her she hadn’t passed after all. A letter addressed to Kelsie, from the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency’s (DVSA) Operational Delivery Manager, Mark Aston, said a serious fault had been recorded during her test. The letter, dated April 14, read: “After your test on Wednesday 11th April at 13:35 our in-house checks identified a serious fault had been assessed and recorded during your test but due to an administrative error, your examiner issued a pass. “You can only pass your test if you receive fewer than 15 driving faults and there are no serious or dangerous faults recorded. “With this in mind, I am sorry to confirm that you have not passed your driving test and that you should only be driving in accordance with the provisional licence regulations.” It added: “Finally, please accept my sincere apologies for any upset and inconvenience that this error may have caused.”

title: royal wedding facts figures cake
story: NewsRoyal Wedding facts and figures: From the cake, to the cost and big moments you may have missedNow we've had time to process everything that happened on the big day, we look at the facts and figures from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's big day&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByJo-Anne RowneyDeputy Audience Growth Editor17:26, 23 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email It was to be expected, but Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding day was a huge undertaking - taking a massive amount of time, money and teamwork to make it all come together. Their family and friends gathered - along with millions of people around the world - to see the happy pair say I do. With so much going on though you may have missed a few things. It's a little frightening when you consider how much work went into a single day. We've taken a look at the facts and figures to break it all down for you. Meghan followed in Princess Diana's footsteps Harry and Meghan read traditional vows from the Common Book of Prayer, though Meghan left out the word obey - just like Diana did. Kate Middleton also left the word out when she married William in 2011. Meghan made history  Meghan began her wedding procession alone - after her father remained in the USA or an operation - though she was joined by Prince Charles at the Quire. She's the first royal bride to walk down the aisle without an escort. Meghan and Harry got new titles Hours before the wedding, the Queen announced they were now the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. There were a ton of celebs at the wedding and reception  David and Victoria Beckham were there, as were Amal and George Clooney. James Corden rocked up with his wife, and compered the reception later, even getting the royals to dance off. Meghan's friends, including Serena Williams, Priyanka Chopra and her Suits co-stars also were invited to the wedding.  Harry's exes were at the wedding Cressida Bonas and Chelsy Davis both attended, but everyone was fine with it, because that's what the royals do. Meghan's veil had intricate details  The 15-ft long veil was designed by Givenchy's Clare Waight Keller. She had flowers for every single commonwealth country as per Meghan's request. Meghan had two dresses The first was by Givenchy, the second was by Stella McCartney and was more Hollywood in its look - a lily white halter neck. Meghan wore shoes from Aquazurra made in silky satin, with nude mesh and soles painted in baby blue.  Meghan's tiara was her something old She wore Queen Mary's old tiara which was lent to her by Queen Elizabeth II. She deliberately had subtle make up Just like Kate, Meghan had her close friends do her makeup rather than a professional.  Meghan's dad wasn't there Thomas Markle Snr had causes quite the drama beforehand. He was set to attend the wedding, but caused controversy when it was revealed pap pictures of him reading a book about London and googling his daughter were set up. It later emerged he needed a heart operation and would be unable to fly to the wedding or walk Meghan down the aisle. He told TMZ: My baby looks beautiful, and she looks very happy. He added: I wish I were there, and I wish them all my love and happiness.  Though her mum was - and alone   Doria Ragland sat alone, though it's thought the Bride and Groom sorted the seating. Harry's family were on the right, Meghan's on the left. She had a tear in her eye as she watched her daughter get married. What Harry said to Charles When Prince Charles reached Harry at the altar , Harry looked at him and said: Thank you, Pa. The entertainment in the church was amazing There were 23 boy choristers from St George's School as well as Sheku Kanneh-Mason, the 19-year-old who won BBC Young Musician of the Year, who was the cellist at the wedding. There was also a gospel choir who sang Etta James and Stand By Me. There were twins as page boys  The son of Meghan's best friend Jessica were page boys - Brian and John held her veil and looked very excited about it all. Prince George was also a page boy and his sister Charlotte was a bridesmaid. There were no adult bridemaids.  There was an A-list guestlist 600 invitations were made by Barnard &amp Westwood for the event, though only 200 were invited to Frogmore House. The couple also invited members of the public, with 2,640 people getting an invite. Made up of 1,200 nominated by nine regional Lord Lieutenent officers 200 people from charities and organisations 100 pupils from local schools the Royal School and St George's School 610 Windsor Castle's community members 530 members of the Royal Households and Crown Estate. Bishop Michael Curry went down a storm  The preacher gave a stirring sermon, that had the royals looking a little shocked. People seemed to love it though, and the message about civil rights, love and the power to change the world. It was a big logistical event Volunteers helped out on the day, with 140 Royal Borough Ambassadors stewarding. It cost &pound30 to park at the Review Ground on the day, and there were 6,000 spots. Security operation About &pound30m was spent on security for the wedding. The Met Police identified 160 'stalkers' before the event.  TV channels All the channels from around the world descended on Windsor. Most impressive though was Sky who laid 27km of cable to broadcast the coverage in UHD, making them the first broadcaster to televise it in 4k. Their first dance was to Whitney Houston They went for something a bit different and had I Wanna Dance With Somebody - instead of dancing alone they invited their guests to the dancefloor with them. They went into a bit of jive and lindy hop. Jaguar E-Type  The number plate was the date of the wedding. The car was a silver blue classic convertible Jaguar E-Type Concept Zero, originally made in 1968 but made into an electric car. The reception was at Frogmore House ...so called because of the frogs that live in the low lying marshy area. It's only open on three ticketed charity days. Guests partied in a glass marquee, it was also where they had their sit down meal.  The cake was massive There was quite an ingredients list for the cake.   The flowers were donated to a hospice  Floral designer Phillippa Craddock directed a team, including florists from St George's Chapel and Buckingham Palace, to create the wedding displays. The flowers have gone to St Joseph's Hospice in Hackney, East London.   They had a great evening reception  There's so many details from the reception we gathered them all together in our behind-the-scenes break down of what happened . Highlights included a firework display at 11pm, George Clooney dancing with Meghan, but being shunned by Fergie and a special cocktail being created for Harry with ginger in it as a nod to his red hair.  Dirty burgers were served with candyfloss. Serena Williams played beer pong Apparently she played it like it was tennis.  Idris Elba had a turn on the decks While DJ Sam Totolee provided the music in the main, Idis did a stint as well. Think 80s and R&ampB. Elton John sang a Disney song  He also sang Tiny Dancer, Your Song, and I'm Still Standing. The Disney song was Circle of Life. Meghan gave a speech Harry gave a speech as did Prince William, where he teased his brother, but Meghan also stood up to talk. She thanked Charles for walking her down the aisle and for such a warm welcome. Awww. Meghan was given Diana's ring

title: she looked like sleeping parents
story: News'She looked like she was sleeping': Parents use special mattress to preserve daughter's body for a week after her deathTragic Daisy Nimmo's family say they collected precious memories by having her in their home for a week after the 12-year-old passed away&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByRhian Lubin01:07, 24 MAY 2018NewsDaisy Nimmo's body was preserved by a special cold mattress (Image: Stephanie Nimmo)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWearing her favourite Disney dress and with flowers in her hair, Daisy Nimmo looked like a little princess. Her eyes were closed and she seemed peacefully asleep, with fairy lights around her bed as her favourite music played softly in the background. The image still brings so much comfort to her mum Stephanie because, tragically, Daisy wasn’t asleep, she had died at the age of just 12. It was thanks to a special mattress Stephanie was able to collect such precious memories during a week with her little girl after she had passed away. For the mum and her three other children, being able to say goodbye to Daisy in their own home was crucial to the grieving process.  “She just looked like she was asleep,” the 49-year-old mum says. “It was amazing to be able to feel like she was with us. You have these visions of her looking like something from Silent Witness, lying there in the mortuary, but it was just like having her home again.” Daisy died in 2017 of a rare condition called Costello syndrome, which affects fewer than 300 children worldwide. It is caused by a mutation of a cancer- causing gene, which meant Daisy had a 17% increased risk of developing a cancerous tumour, heart and bone problems. She lived longer than doctors expected but eventually it was too much for her body to cope with. After she died, Daisy’s family were able to take her home to Wimbledon, South West London, for an extra week before they laid her to rest because of the special cold mattress. “When Daisy came home she was in her nightie, we put her duvet on her and tucked her toys around her,” Stephanie says. “I played her music, the soundtrack to Frozen, we had some candles on. My children and I just drifted in and out of her room. It was like she was sleeping. But I did keep expecting her to wake up and say ‘go away!’  “People might hear that and say, ‘Oh my God, that’s really freaky’, but it felt like the most natural thing in the world. I felt I’d reclaimed her. I’d brought her away from a traumatic death and a medical environment and she was just my little girl tucked up in bed.” The technology is not widely available but a small number of hospices have the mattresses. Stephanie, a writer and campaigner, explains: “It’s a blue, plastic-coated mattress and it has cooling fluid and is attached to a tube. It acts like a padded fridge or a freezer block, you put that on the bed and put normal bedding over the top. “I was astounded that there is very little information about these cold mattresses. If Daisy had been under a different hospice, we wouldn’t have been able to take her home after she died. “The most horrific thing for me is that she would’ve had to go to the mortuary. Embalming was the other option, which is horrible. How horrific – you’ve just lost a child and then have to go through that. “The mattresses seem to be really rare, we were so lucky our hospice uses them.” They took Daisy home for a night and then spent seven nights with her at Shooting Star Chase children’s hospice, where she spent so much of her life.  It has been a traumatic couple of years for the family. Stephanie’s husband of 23 years Andy died from cancer a year before Daisy in December 2015, leaving Stephanie as a single mum to Daisy, Theo, 21, Xanthe, 19, and Jules, 15. Being able to spend the extra time with Daisy has been hugely beneficial to them all. Theo and Jules decided that the night with Daisy at home brought them enough closure, but Stephanie and Xanthe spent the rest of the week with her in the hospice, where they re-created Daisy’s bedroom. Stephanie says: “My other daughter spent so much time with Daisy in the hospice, she painted her nails, did her make-up. After Andy died, she didn’t want to be there right at the end. “But actually with Daisy, she said being able to spend time with her and dress her up in her favourite Princess Anna dress, from Frozen, and put all her toys around her was so healing.” Now Stephanie is able to remember her daughter at peace. “Daisy looked so relaxed at the end,” she says. “She had been in a lot of pain for the last few months of her life and was very tense. When she died, we all said how long she looked because she wasn’t tense any more. “In my mind I have that beautiful picture, not on a ventilator and bloated from the fluid, with tubes everywhere. “I have a nice picture. Had I not been able to have that, my last memory of her would’ve been before she went to the mortuary.”

title: what princess dianas lover james
story: NewsWhat Princess Diana's lover James Hewitt was doing on Prince Harry's wedding dayFormer army officer James Hewitt spent the day of Prince Harry's wedding shopping in Exeter&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByIsaac Crowson13:59, 23 MAY 2018Updated01:31, 24 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPrincess Diana's former lover James Hewitt spent Prince Harry's wedding day doing his weekly shop, it has emerged. The former army officer was never going to be invited to the Windsor event after the scandal of his affair with Harry's mum. Instead Mr Hewitt, 60, was spotted shopping at Sainsbury's in Exeter, the city where he lives with his mother Shirley in a two-bedroom flat. He packed beer, wine and food into the back of his Audi, and was smartly dressed in suit trousers, braces and a shirt and tie, suggesting he may have been going to a party to celebrate Harry's marriage to Meghan Markle. He was then seen spending the afternoon with a mystery blonde woman in a Devon village 15 miles away, reports Mail Online. title: woman stoma bag told go
story: NewsWoman with stoma bag 'told to go to needle exchange' after being denied syringes on NHSCharlotte Bonwick, from West Sussex, says she has been forced to start paying £500-a-month to fund her own medication for intestinal failure&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByDaniel HammondHeather McNeill20:30, 23 MAY 2018NewsThe 23-year-old says without her anti-sickness mediation, she drastically loses weight, leading to other health complications (Image: SWNS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A young woman who needs to inject life-saving medication three times daily says she has been denied a NHS prescription for syringes 'due to cutbacks'.  Charlotte Bonwick, who has a permanent stoma bag and is fed through a tube, claims she was told by the service to instead get her clean needles from an exchange usually reserved for drug addicts. The 23-year-old, who was born with her intestines outside her body, needs to inject medication every eight hours to stabilise her body, which has been ravaged by sepsis a shocking six times. The West Sussex woman claims she was recently told by her doctor she could no longer have a NHS script for hypodermic syringes.  She also says her regular prescription for anti-sickness drug, Cyclizine, which she needs to inject to help keep water down and weight on, had been reduced to meagre rations and was having negative impacts on her health. Due to absorption problems, I cannot just take a tablet. I have to have medication in other forms, eg. patches which stick onto the skin and release the drug, injections, medication that melts under the tongue, IV through my central line. These medications are so important when trying to live life as normal as possible. Too fearful to visit a needle exchange, the young woman, who is so ill she cannot work, has begun borrowing money from her parents to afford the &pound500-a-month private prescription for syringes. She said: This whole thing came out of the blue, I had no warning whatsoever - it's made me really upset because now I can't rely on them.  Whenever I went to go and pick up my prescription they said they lost it - that's how it started. They couldn't tell me where the prescription was - it came across a bit strange. I have been on drugs since I was born - it seems they are just phasing me out, they told me that the drugs were just too expensive, but these are the only ones that work.” How am I supposed to take my medication.  Free charity needle exchanges are usually set up to improve the health of drug addicts by giving them a free way to get new needles, rather than having to share. She contacted Mid Sussex East Shoreham CCG to raise her issue . She added: They told me to go the needle exchange.

title: world cup heist solved 52
story: NewsWorld Cup heist finally solved as 52-year riddle of 1966 Jules Rimet trophy theft leads to gangland brothers who 'nicked it for the thrill'WORLD EXCLUSIVE: After a 10-month investigation, the Daily Mirror can reveal the Jules Rimet trophy was stolen by London gangster Sidney Cugullere and his brother Reg - and why they dumped it in a hedge&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByTom Pettifor23:01, 23 MAY 2018Updated23:43, 23 MAY 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSidney Cugullere loved to boast that he was the first Englishman to lift the World Cup – long before a victorious Bobby Moore at Wembley. Gangland’s “Mr Crafty”, Sidney was the man who stole the Jules Rimet trophy months before England hosted the 1966 tournament, the Mirror reveals today. Until now mystery has surrounded its theft, and what happened to the precious cup in the week before it was found again by a dog called Pickles. But now, with the 2018 World Cup just 22 days away, our investigation tells for the first time the story behind one of the world’s most notorious thefts.   'He was thieving from a young age': The life and crimes of the man who stole the 1966 World Cup  Armed robber Sidney, then 40, stole the trophy with the help of brother Reg, say three independent sources with knowledge of the heist including Reg’s son Gary. And he did it just for fun, says Gary, who decided to tell the story after he was approached by the Mirror. He said: “Sidney just nicked it for the thrill – not for financial gain, but just because it was so easy.” It led to one of the biggest manhunts in Scotland Yard’s history and became a bigger story than that year’s general election. But Cugullere died of cancer in 2005, aged 79, having never been caught.  Only a handful of relatives, friends and gangland figures have known the truth. One source said: “Many a time Sid would say he was the first Englishman to lift the World Cup in 1996 and that he did it before Bobby Moore. “He was an opportunist and the stealing of the Cup was just that. He didn’t have any inside information or help from the guards. It was spur of the moment.” He had tried to extort a ransom of &pound15,000 for the trophy with the help of pal Ted Betchley, but the plan went wrong after his friend was arrested. Yet still he was not exposed as the culprit.   The Mirror has spent 10 months tracing Cugullere’s history and family after a source disclosed the thief was a man named “Sidney Coo”. Using interviews with insiders, police files and National Archives records we pieced together the most complete picture so far of what happened. Cugullere, jailed for more than 25 years for other offences, took the winged Greek goddess figurine on Sunday 20 March 1966 from the Methodist Central Hall in Westminster, Central London.   History of Jules Rimet trophy as mystery behind stolen 1966 World Cup revealed  It was insured for &pound30,000 and was being exhibited in a glass cabinet by the Stanley Gibbons stamp company. Sir Stanley Rous, the president of FIFA, had only agreed to it being released from the FA headquarters on condition it was watched 24 hours a day. The exhibition was closed on the Sunday and there were four guards on duty, split into two pairs. One source said Cugullere told him in the 1980s how he had pulled off the burglary. He had driven to Westminster from his home in Walworth, South East London, to case out security after hearing the Cup was on display there.  Wearing a brown removals-style coat he walked into the area open to the public and went to the locked room where the trophy was housed in a padlocked cabinet. The source said: “There were those door handles you get on schools, the large metal ones, and he realised he could unscrew them and get in. The handle fell and was hanging there.”  The handles were holding a wooden bar across the rear doors. Once removed, Cugullere could get inside. The insider said: “Sid had a bag with his tools including bolt cutters. “He said he couldn’t believe it was just in a glass-fronted wooden cabinet with a chain and a little Woolworths padlock on it, and no security watching it. He cut the chain and in seconds got the cabinet open. When he got it out, he braced himself to lift it, expecting it to be very heavy.  “But he said it was so light it was untrue. He said it wouldn’t have made much as scrap in them days.” Cugullere then put the trophy in his bag and walked out. Gary says his father Reg told him he was also in the Methodist Central Hall, but did not see Sidney take the cup. He said: “On the street after coming out of the doors Sid lifted his jacket and said, ‘’Ere you are, Reg, look at this’. He opened one side of his jacket and the World Cup was there.  “My dad went: “F***ing hell, Sid, what the f*** do you think we are going to do with that?” Back at the Methodist Central Hall, security guards were in for a shock. Senior guard Frank Hudson was meant to be keeping a constant eye on the Cup with colleague George Franklin on the first floor. Franklin later told police he checked the Cup at 11am before going for a coffee with Hudson.  At 12.10pm, one of the downstairs guards found the padlock on the case removed and the trophy stolen. The next day police issued a description of a lone thief in his late 30s, around 5ft 10in with sallow skin, dark eyes and greased-down black hair. The description fitted Cugullere. Sidney took the trophy home, but soon realised his wife Nell “would have flung him out” if she found it. So he called Reg, who took it home in his car to Leighton Buzzard, Beds.And that’s when police nearly found the trophy they were all searching for. The source said: “Reggie had it under the front seat. He got pulled at a general stop by the police and they searched the car but didn’t find it.” Rewards totalling &pound5,500 were soon offered for its safe return, far more than Sidney could get if he melted down the 14in gold-plated silver Cup.  DI Len Buggy of the elite Flying Squad led the probe. His break came when the Chelsea and FA chairman Joe Mears was phoned by a man calling himself Jackson, who said a parcel would be arriving the next day. It arrived three days after the theft, on the Wednesday, and contained lining from the trophy and a ransom note demanding &pound15,000 in five and one-pound notes. The note, written by Cugullere, said: “Dear Joe Kno (sic) doubt you view with very much concern the loss of the world cup...to me it is only so much scrap gold.” He said the cup would be “for the POT” if the ransom was not paid. Buggy posed as Mears and arranged to meet “Jackson” in Battersea Park – in fact Sidney’s friend Ted Betchley, 46, a former docker. Betchley was arrested. He insisted he was just the middleman, paid &pound500 for his part, and was jailed for just two years. Gary said soon after the theft Reg and Sidney hid the World Cup in Reg’s father-in-law’s coal shed. He added: “My dad was freaking out and he knew there was no way they could sell the cup. They didn’t melt it down or destroy it because it’s the World Cup. They realised they had to give it back.”  Seven days after the theft, on March 27, docker David Corbett was taking his cross-bred collie Pickles for a walk when he spotted the cup in the street. It remains unclear how it got there. Corbett collected &pound6,000 in rewards. Bobby Moore went on to lift the Cup after England defeated Germany 4-2 in the eighth World Cup final.

title: hungover british tourist pictured ordering
story: News'Hungover British tourist' pictured ordering burger in Majorca with her bare bum on full displayThe woman, believed to be from the UK, is reported to have gone into the shop with a sore head after a night partying&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByGerard Couzens11:39, 23 MAY 2018Updated14:50, 23 MAY 2018NewsThe scenes were caught on camera on the island of Majorca (Image: Getty Images Europe)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman believed to be a British tourist has been seen ordering a burger with her bare bum on show. She is reported to have gone into the fast food restaurant after a night of partying. The woman is wearing a sheer top and tiny black skirt that is hitched up around her waist. German newspaper Bild said she was filmed in the Majorcan town of Inca at 11am on Sunday. Majorcan newspaper Ultima Hora also carried the picture, linking it to the drunken tourism the island is fighting against. The newspaper also mentioned the party resort Magaluf , which is 29 miles away from Inca. Inca is in the centre of the island and is not a mass tourism hotspot.  Bild claimed the woman was with with two friends and needed the burger as a hangover cure and headlined its article “This is how you ask for a hamburger in Majorca”. It added: “Her already tight skirt has probably slipped over her buttocks.”  It was previously reported how boozy British tourists had been warned to think twice before stripping naked in Magaluf as they could be fined hundreds of pounds. Officials on the Spanish island introduced new laws in 2015 to clean up its image as a wild party town for stag and hen dos and tanked-up teens.  Anyone found committing alcohol-fuelled rowdy acts like balcony hopping, urinating in public and skinny-dipping can now be given an on-the-spot fine. CCTV and police patrols were also beefed up, as well as a ban on drinking in the street between 10pm and 8am, and shops can no longer sell booze after midnight. Anyone found urinating in the street and being naked in public could be made to pay €750 (&pound658). Spanish authorities have been cracking down on unruly behaviour on the streets of Magaluf in recent years.  In April it was reported Magaluf cops have banned a pub crawl by 90 boozy Brits in a clampdown on “uncivic” behaviour. Police said the outing was “totally against” regulations put in place to combat public drunkenness by visitors to the popular tourist island. The bar crawl promised drinking games, an open bar and a bucking bronco for revellers. The group, which was led by two guides from Ireland, was visiting its second pub in the Punta Ballena area of the city when police intervened.

title: approval for homes tied up at site of dundee rope factory
story: Approval has been granted to develop housing on the site of a derelict Dundee factory.Members of the council’s planning committee have granted permission for the development on the site of the former Tay Rope Works in the West End Lanes conservation area of Dundee.F &amp H Developments, of Crieff, had applied to the city council for permission to build the houses at Magdalen Yard Road.The developer plans to build a range of five three-bedroomed houses and two three-bedroomed flats with parking, amenity space, a new access and environmental improvements at the site.The land, at 51 Magdalen Yard Road, was originally occupied by the Tay Rope Works which dated from the mid-19th Century.The area, as required by rope manufacturers, is extremely long and narrow.A report to the planning committee said: “The site is predominantly vacant and derelict with a southern elevation to Magdalen Yard Road comprising a category C-listed facade for the original Tay Rope Works building.”Permission was also granted to demolish and reconstruct the building’s facade.The report added: “There is a long history of planning applications for residential development on all or parts of the site dating back to 1993.“The present proposal for five houses and two flats was originally granted permission in September 2011.“It was renewed in March 2015.“The present one effectively seeks a further renewal of the proposals granted planning permission in 2011 and 2015.”The report said: “The application fails to fully comply with Policy 9 (Design of Housing) in relation to amenity space provision.“There are material considerations which weigh-in in support of the application. It is recommended it be approved subject to conditions.”Plans to redevelop the site were first put forward a quarter of a century ago.No one from the developers was available for comment at the time of going to press.

title: completion of 5m dundee water network upgrade delayed again
story: The completion of a £5 million Dundee-wide water network upgrade has been delayed for a second time.Scottish Water and Caledonia Water Alliance started work on the project in 2016 and it was originally scheduled for completion late last year.Now, however, it’s been announced that there has been a further delay.It is expected that the work will not now be completed until “late summer”.Dundee City Council’s convener of city development Lynne Short said that although it was frustrating, the work had to be carried out and it would be worth it in the end.Councillor Short said: “Myself and council officers are aware of the delay and we have asked Scottish Water to explain the situation.“We continue to thank people for their patience and assure them that the work should be completed as soon as possible.“We are having many miles of very old pipes replaced and in the end we will have a pipe network worthy of our city.”Some of the city’s pipes had lain untouched for more than a century prior to the work starting.While the works have been ongoing, many streets have seen closures and disruptions.Work has so far been completed on more than 50 miles of water mains.This has led to improvements for more than 15,000 households.A spokesman for Scottish Water said: “Scottish Water’s £5m mains upgrade across Dundee is expected to be completed by late summer.“Caledonia Water Alliance, which is our alliance partner carrying out the project on Scottish Water’s behalf, has to date replaced or refurbished more than 80km of mains across the city.“As the project has progressed, some of the pipework initially earmarked for refurbishment has had to be replaced due to its condition, meaning a knock-on effect on the initial timescales for the job.“This essential project is being carried out to ensure the people of Dundee can continue to enjoy clear, fresh drinking water long into the future and we thank customers across the city for their patience and understanding as this work continues.”
